translated: This region called Chakradhara is situated on the southern bank of the Vitasta river.

original: kecid vadanti /
analyzed: kecid vadanti
translated: Some say:

original: atra cakadharasyādhastād eko mahāvidhir asti /
analyzed: atra ekaḥ mahā vidhiḥ asti
translated: Below this Chakradhara, there is a great rule.

original: pūrvasmin kāle ye kecana tena pathā gatāgataṃ kurvāṇā abhūvaṃs te 'vaśyam eva sarvadaivānusāreṇa prācīnarūpakaniṣkāparaparyāyadīnnārādilābhabhājo 🔽bhavanti sma /
analyzed: pūrvasmin kāle ye kecana tena pathā gatāgatam kurvāṇāḥ abhūvan te vaśyam eva sarva daiva anusāreṇa prācīna rūpaka niṣka apara paryāya dīnnāra ādi lābha bhājaḥ  bhavanti sma
translated: In the past, those who went and came by that path must have always obtained the ancient form, the Nishka, the Parayana, the Dinara, etc.

original: ādhunike kāle 'pi yaḥ ko 'py atidurgatatamaḥ pumān daityam āśrityātibhaktyā cakadharam amuṃ pradeśaṃ tam eva cakradharam manyamāno dhanāśayā 🔽gacchati /
analyzed: ādhunike kāle pi yaḥ kaḥ pi ati durgatatamaḥ pumān daityam āśritya atibhaktyā amum pradeśam tam eva cakradharam manyamānaḥ dhana āśayā  gacchati
translated: In the modern age also, whatever extremely unfortunate man, relying on the demon, and with great devotion, considering this region Chakradhara and that Chakradhara itself, goes for the sake of wealth,

original: so 'py avaśyaṃ kim api dhanādikaṃ labhata eva /
analyzed: saḥ u pi avaśyam kim api dhana ādikam labhate eva
translated: he too certainly obtains something like wealth.

original: ayaṃ pradeśaḥ kaśmīranagarāt pūrvasmin bhāge caturdaśabhiḥ krośair dūre bhavati /
analyzed: ayam pradeśaḥ kaśmīra nagarāt pūrvasmin bhāge caturdaśabhiḥ krośaiḥ dūre bhavati
translated: This place is fourteen krośas east of the city of Kashmir.

original: anantanāgād ye kaśmīranagaraṃ samāgacchanti teṣāṃ tu pūrvam evāyaṃ pradeśas trīn eva krośān samullaṅghya dṛggocaram āgacchati /
analyzed: ananta nāgāt ye kaśmīra nagaram samāgacchanti teṣām tu pūrvam eva ayam pradeśaḥ trīn eva krośān samullaṅghya dṛś gocaram āgacchati
translated: But for those who come to the city of Kashmir from Ananta Nāga, this place is within sight, having crossed only three krośas to the east.

original: vijayeśvarād ayam ekenaiva krośena dūro bhavati /
analyzed: vijayeśvarāt ayam ekena eva krośena dūraḥ bhavati
translated: This is one krośa away from Vijayeśvara.

original: asya cakradharasya pādabhūmau cirā vṛkṣāḥ kāśmīrikā api santīti śam //
analyzed: asya cakradharasya pāda bhūmau cirāḥ vṛkṣāḥ kāśmīrikāḥ api santi iti śam
translated: And on the ground of this Cakradhara, there are also trees of Kashmir for a long time. Thus, peace!

original: Vijayeśvaraḥ
translated: Vijayeśvara

original: ślokasaṃ nambara vijayeśaḥ /
analyzed: ślokasam nambara vijaya īśaḥ
translated: The number of verses is Vijayeśa.

original: viśeṣeṇa sarveṣu devagaṇeṣu jayati sarvotkarṣeṇa vartate yaḥ sa vijayaḥ /
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa sarveṣu deva gaṇeṣu jayati sarva utkarṣeṇa vartate yaḥ sa vijayaḥ
translated: He who conquers in particular among all the hosts of gods, who exists with supreme victory, is Vijaya.

original: atha vā vividhān daityādigaṇāñ jayati parābhavati vā yaḥ sa vijayaḥ /
analyzed: atha vā vividhān daitya ādi gaṇām jayati parābhavati vā yaḥ sa vijayaḥ
translated: Or, he who conquers or defeats various hosts of demons and others is Vijaya.

original: sa cāsāv īśaḥ īṣṭe aiśvaryaṃ vidadhāti yaḥ sa īśaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca asau īśaḥ īṣṭe aiśvaryam vidadhāti yaḥ saḥ īśaḥ
translated: And he is Īśa, who desires, who bestows lordship, is Īśa.

original: vijaya eva īśaḥ vijayeśaḥ /
analyzed: vijaya eva īśaḥ vijayeśaḥ
translated: Vijaya is Īśa, Vijayeśa.

original: asmin pradeśe sthitā śivasya mūrtir vijayeśapadavācyā yata īśapadābhidheyā sarvatra śivasyaiva mūrtiḥ paripaṭhyate /
analyzed: asmin pradeśe sthitā śivasya mūrtiḥ vijayeśa pada vācyā yatas īśa pada abhidheyā sarvatra śivasya eva mūrtiḥ paripaṭhyate
translated: In this region, the form of Shiva is denoted by the word Vijayeśa, because the form of Shiva is referred to everywhere by the word Īśa.

original: ayaṃ vijayeśvarākhyaḥ pradeśo 'ticirakālād anenaiva nāmnā sarvadākhyātatamo 'py anumīyate /
analyzed: ayam vijayeśvara ākhyaḥ ti cira kālāt anena eva nāmnā anumīyate
translated: This region called Vijayeśvara, which has been well-known by this very name for a very long time, is inferred.

original: yato 'tra jīrṇoddhārādikarmakartāra eva labhyante /
analyzed: yatas tra jīrṇa uddhāra ādi karma kartāraḥ eva labhyante
translated: Because only those who perform the work of repairing old temples etc. are found here.

original: na tu sākṣāt kartur nāma prāyaśo niścīyate /
analyzed: na tu sākṣāt kartuḥ nāma prāyaśas niścīyate
translated: But the name of the actual doer is not usually ascertained.

original: yasmāt kalhaṇapaṇḍito 'pi svakīyarājataraṅgiṇīyāḥ prathamataraṅgasyaikaśatādhike pañcamaśloke likhatīti /
analyzed: yasmāt kalhaṇa paṇḍitaḥ pi svakīya rājataraṅgiṇīyāḥ prathama taraṅgasya ekaśata adhike pañcama śloke likhati iti
translated: Because the scholar Kalhana also writes in the fifth verse more than a hundred years after the first wave of his own Rājatarangiṇī.

original: tathā hi🔽jīrṇaṃ śrīvijayeśasya vinivārya sudhāmayam /
analyzed: tathā hi  jīrṇam śrī vijayeśasya vinivārya sudhā mayam
translated: Thus:🔽Having removed the old, made of lime, of the glorious Vijayeśa,

original: niṣkalmaṣeṇāśmamayaḥ prākāro yena kāritaḥ //
analyzed: niṣkalmaṣeṇa aśma mayaḥ prākāraḥ yena kāritaḥ
translated: he had a faultless, stone wall built by him.

original: yena rājñā aśokenety arthaḥ /
analyzed: yena rājñā aśokena iti arthaḥ
translated: By which king, meaning by King Aśoka.

original: atra sudhāmayasya prākārasya vinivāraṇakathanena tathāśmamayasya prākārasya sampādanakathanenāpi aśokarājaḥ pūrvam apy asya pradeśasya sadbhāvenātiprācīnatvam
analyzed: atra sudhā mayasya prākārasya vinivāraṇa kathanena tathā aśma mayasya prākārasya sampādana kathanena api aśoka rājaḥ pūrvam api asya pradeśasya sadbhāvena ati prācīna tvam
translated: Here, by the mention of the removal of the lime wall and the mention of the completion of the stone wall, King Aśoka's presence in this region in the past indicates its great antiquity.

original: evāvagamyate /
analyzed: eva avagamyate
translated: This is understood.

original: pārisekapustakeṣu kecid ayaṃ vijayeśvarākhyaḥ pradeśo rājñā surendreṇa yo 'śokād rājño 'py atipūrvakālīno 'bhūt tenaiva sampādito 'sty iti
analyzed: pāriseka pustakeṣu kecid ayam vijayeśvara ākhyaḥ pradeśaḥ rājñā surendreṇa śokāt rājñaḥ pi ati pūrva kālīnaḥ bhūt tena eva sampāditaḥ asti iti
translated: In the Parisheka manuscripts, some say that this region called Vijayeśvara was accomplished by King Surendra himself, who was even earlier than King Aśoka.

original: anye tu īśānadevīti khyātayā surendrāśokayo rājñor uttarakālabhāvino bhuvo bhartur jalaukasya rājñyā nirmito 'stīti kathayanti /
analyzed: anye tu īśānadevī iti khyātayā sura indra aśokayoḥ rājñoḥ uttara kāla bhāvinaḥ bhuvaḥ bhartuḥ jalaukasya rājñyā nirmitaḥ asti iti kathayanti
translated: But others say that it was created by the queen of King Jalauka, the ruler of the earth, who was famous as Īśānadevī and who lived after the two kings Surendra and Aśoka.

original: kecana aśokenaiva rājñā ca pradeśe prathamato nirmāṇaṃ kṛtam iti svapustake likhamānā dṛśyante /
analyzed: kecana aśokena eva rājñā ca pradeśe prathamatas nirmāṇam kṛtam iti sva pustake likhamānāḥ dṛśyante
translated: Some are seen writing in their own manuscripts that the creation of this region was first done by King Aśoka himself.

original: paraṃ tu uktamatatrayāt kim api saṃgatatamaṃ samīcīnaṃ vā na bhāti /
analyzed: param tu ukta mata trayāt kim api saṃgatatamam samīcīnam vā na bhāti
translated: But nothing seems to be very appropriate or correct due to the above-mentioned reasons.

original: tatra rājataraṅgiṇyāṃ prathamataraṅgasyaikādhikanavatitamaślokād varṇyamāne surendrasya rājño varṇane sarvasminn api vijayeśvarasya nāmāpi
analyzed: tatra rājataraṅgiṇyām prathama taraṅgasya eka adhika navatitama ślokāt varṇyamāne sura indrasya rājñaḥ varṇane sarvasmin api vijayeśvarasya nāma api
translated: There, in the description of King Surendra in the ninety-first verse of the first wave of the Rājataranginī, the name Vijayeśvara is not mentioned at all.

original: ataḥ surendrasampādito 'yam ity apy asaṃyuktam /
analyzed: atas sura indra sampāditaḥ yam iti api a saṃyuktam
translated: Therefore, it is also inappropriate to say that this was accomplished by Surendra.

original: ye tu vadanti jalaukarājña īśānadevīti khyātayā rājñyāyaṃ pradeśo nirmita iti tatra
analyzed: ye tu vadanti jalauka rājñaḥ īśānadevī iti khyātayā rājñyā ayam pradeśaḥ nirmitaḥ iti tatra
translated: But those who say that this region was built by Queen Jaleoka, known as Queen Ishanadevi, there

original: rājataraṅgiṇyāṃ prathamataraṅgasyaikaśatādhikasaptamaślokād varṇyamāne jalaukasya
analyzed: rājataraṅgiṇyām prathama taraṅgasya ekaśata adhika saptama ślokāt varṇyamāne jalaukasya
translated: in the Rajatarangini, in the character of King Jaleoka, described in the one hundred and seventh verse of the first wave,

original: rājñaś caritre tadantargata eva tadrājñyāḥ pūrvoktāyāś cāritre 'pi kvāpi vijayeśvarakhyātāṃ na labhyate /
analyzed: rājñaḥ caritre tad antargate eva tad rājñyāḥ pūrvoktāyāḥ cāritre kvāpi vijayeśvara khyātām na labhyate
translated: in the character of that queen mentioned earlier, is not found anywhere under the name Vijayeshvara.

original: atas tad apy asaṃgatam eva bhāti /
analyzed: atas tat api asaṃgatam eva bhāti
translated: Therefore, that too seems to be irrelevant.

original: ye tu aśokarājānam eva vijayeśvarasampādakam manyamānāḥ svapustakeṣu aśoka eva vijayeśvarasampādaka
analyzed: ye tu aśoka rājānam eva vijayeśvara sampādakam manyamānāḥ sva pustakeṣu aśokaḥ eva vijayeśvara sampādaka
translated: But those who consider King Ashoka himself to be the maker of Vijayeshvara, and write in their books that Ashoka alone is the maker of Vijayeshvara,🔽having obtained the construction of a new stone wall after stopping the old wall made of lime,

original: ityādi likhanti te sudhāmayajīrṇaprākāraṃ nivārya navīnam aśmamayaprākārasampādanaṃ🔽rājataraṅgiṇīta eva labdhvā tasyaiva jīrṇoddhārādikarmaṇaḥ sākṣāt sampādanaṃ jānantas tathā likhanti /
analyzed: ityādi likhanti te sudhā maya jīrṇa prākāram nivārya navīnam aśma maya prākāra sampādanam  rājataraṅgiṇītaḥ eva labdhvā tasya eva jīrṇa uddhāra ādi karmaṇaḥ sākṣāt sampādanam jānantaḥ tathā likhanti
translated: they write that they know the direct construction of that same old repair work.

original: atas teṣāṃ tad apy avicāritam eva bhāti /
analyzed: atas teṣām tat api avicāritam eva bhāti
translated: Therefore, that too seems to be unthoughtful on their part.

original: yataḥ sampādakajīrṇoddhārakartroḥ parasparaṃ mahān bhedo bhavati /
analyzed: yatas sampādaka jīrṇoddhāra kartroḥ parasparam mahān bhedaḥ bhavati
translated: Because there is a great difference between the constructor and the repairer.

original: vastutas tu rājataraṅgiṇyāḥ prārambhe 'pi vijayeśvarasya nāma sarvathādas adṛśyamānaṃ
analyzed: vastutas tu rāja taraṅgiṇyāḥ prārambhe vijayeśvarasya nāma adṛśyamānam
translated: But in reality, even at the beginning of the Rājatarangiṇī, the name of Vijayāditya is not at all seen.

original: yad bhavaty ato jñāyate kalhaṇapaṇḍitenāpi sākṣād asya pradeśasya kartā na saṃjñātaḥ
analyzed: yat bhavati atas jñāyate kalhaṇa paṇḍitena api sākṣāt asya pradeśasya kartā na saṃjñātaḥ
translated: Therefore, it is known that even by the learned Kalhaṇa, the founder of this region was not known.

original: yatas tenāpi aśokarājñaḥ pūrvam api varṇyamāne rājavṛnde kāpy eṣā vārtā noktāta evāsyātiprācīnatvaṃ
analyzed: yatas tena api aśoka rājñaḥ pūrvam api varṇyamāne rāja vṛnde kā api eṣā vārtā nā uktā atas eva asya ati prācīna tvam
translated: Because even by him, in the assembly of kings described even before the king Aśoka, no such news was mentioned. Therefore, its extreme antiquity

original: samyaktayā pratibhāti /
analyzed: samyak tayā pratibhāti
translated: appears to be true.

original: atrānantanāgād āgamanamārgopalakṣyamāṇavitastāyā vāmapārśve vijayeśvarābhidham etad evāgāraṃ vartate /
analyzed: atra ananta nāgāt āgamana mārga upalakṣyamāṇa vitastāyāḥ vāma pārśve vijayeśvara abhidham etat eva āgāram vartate
translated: Here, on the left bank of the Vitastā, indicated by the path of arrival from Anantanāga, this very house named Vijayāditya exists.

original: kathayanti ca vṛddhāḥ /🔽asmin pradeśe mandirādhidhaṃ devatāgāraṃ pāṣāṇanirmitaṃ sadaivābhūd iti /
analyzed: kathayanti ca vṛddhāḥ  asmin pradeśe mandira adhidham devatāgāram pāṣāṇa nirmitam sadā eva abhūt iti
translated: And the elders say:🔽In this region, a temple made of stone has always existed.

original: paraṃ tv etasmin kāle dṛśyamāṇaṃ pāṣāṇanirmitaṃ yat sthānaṃ pratibhāti tan nākaloke
analyzed: param tu etasmin kāle dṛśyamāṇam pāṣāṇa nirmitam yat sthānam pratibhāti tat nāka loke
translated: But the place that appears to be made of stone in this time, that is in the world of gods.

original: sadgatim āptena śrīraṇavīrasiṃharājñā kaśmīrajamvādyanekadeśādhipatinā bahubhir varṣair
analyzed: sat gatim āptena śrī raṇa vīrasiṃha rājñā kaśmīra jamu ādi aneka deśa adhipatinā bahubhiḥ varṣaiḥ
translated: Having attained a good rebirth, by the illustrious king Rāṇavīraśiṃha, the lord of Kashmir and many other countries, for many years,

original: mahatāyāsenātiprabhūtena yatnenāpi sahasrasaṃkhyākān rūpakān vyayīkṛtya sampāditaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: mahatā āyāsena ati prabhūtena yatnena api sahasra saṃkhyākān rūpakān vyayīkṛtya sampāditam bhavati
translated: It was accomplished with great effort, with a very large amount of exertion, by spending a thousand coins.

original: asmin mandire 'dhunā śivasya pratimāsti /
analyzed: asmin mandire dhunā śivasya pratimā asti
translated: In this temple, there is now an image of Shiva.

original: tatpūjādinirvāhāya rājñā eko grāmo 'py agrahāravyapadeśe nātithipūjāyai ca sthāpito 'sti /
analyzed: tad pūjā ādi nirvāhāya rājñā ekaḥ grāmaḥ pi agrahāra vyapadeśe na atithi pūjāyai ca sthāpitaḥ asti
translated: For the purpose of worshipping it and so on, a village was also established by the king, designated as an agraharam, for the worship of guests.

original: grāmīṇās tu asya mandirasya haricandrakṛtatvam avagacchantaḥ svakīyakaśmīrabhāṣāyāṃ🔽haricandrājan mandir tathāsya nadītaṭāj jalam anvavatīryamāṇasya sopānamārgasya ca
analyzed: grāmīṇāḥ tu asya mandirasya haricandra kṛta tvam avagacchantaḥ svakīya kaśmīra bhāṣāyām  mandiḥ tathā asya nadī taṭāt jalam anvavatīryamāṇasya sopāna mārgasya ca
translated: But the villagers, understanding that this temple was built by Harichandra, in their own Kashmiri language,🔽call it the Harichandraj temple and the staircase path that descends from the riverbank,

original: haricandrājun yārabal iti nāmanī kathayanti /
analyzed: iti nāmanī kathayanti
translated: Harichandrajun yarabal.

original: tatra prathamanāmno haricandrakṛtaṃ mandiram ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tatra prathama nāmnaḥ haricandra kṛtam mandiram iti arthaḥ
translated: There, the first name means the temple built by Harichandra.

original: dvitīyanāmnas tu haricandrasampādito 'yaṃ sopānamārga ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: dvitīya nāmnaḥ tu haricandra sampāditaḥ yam sopāna mārgaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The second name means this staircase path was constructed by Harichandra.

original: yataḥ kaśmīrabhāṣāyāṃ sarveṣāṃ sopānamārgānāṃ yārabalśabdenaiva vyapadeśaḥ /
analyzed: yatas kaśmīra bhāṣāyām sarveṣām sopāna mārgānām yārabala śabdena eva vyapadeśaḥ
translated: Because in the Kashmiri language, all staircase paths are designated only by the word yarabal.

original: tatra kaśmīrabhāṣāyāṃ yār iti sakhyur nāmāsti /
analyzed: tatra kaśmīra bhāṣāyām iti sakhyuḥ nāma asti
translated: There, in the Kashmiri language, yār is the name of a friend.

original: teṣām eva sakhīnāṃ bal sthānam iti yataḥ kaśmīradeśe prātaḥkāla eva sarve snānāya nadītaṭam āśrayante /
analyzed: teṣām eva sakhīnām sthānam iti yatas kaśmīra deśe prātaḥkāle eva sarve snānāya nadī taṭam āśrayante
translated: Because it is the place of rendezvous of those very friends, in the Kashmir country, all gather on the riverbank for bathing in the morning.

original: ato ye parasparaṃ sakhāyas te tatra saṃgacchante /
analyzed: atas ye parasparam sakhāyaḥ te tatra saṃgacchante
translated: Therefore, those who are friends with each other meet there.

original: etasmād eva kāraṇād asya nadītaṭasya yārabal iti nāma sampannam atra vijayeśvarād
analyzed: etasmāt eva kāraṇāt asya nadī taṭasya yārabal iti nāma sampannam atra vijayeśvarāt
translated: For this very reason, this riverbank has come to be known as Yarabal.

original: ūrdhvaṃ katicid eva padāni gatvā cinār iti bhāṣāyāṃ prasiddhā ye śāstrīyabhāṣāyāṃ
analyzed: ūrdhvam katicid eva padāni gatvā iti bhāṣāyām prasiddhāḥ ye śāstrīya bhāṣāyām
translated: Going a few steps beyond Vijayeshvara, there are many trees known in the local language as Chinar,

original: chāyāvṛkṣapadābhidheyās te bahavo vṛkṣāḥ santi /
analyzed: chāyāvṛkṣa pada abhidheyāḥ te bahavaḥ vṛkṣāḥ santi
translated: which are called Chhaya Vrkshas in the classical language.

original: tathā vitastāyā vijayeśvarasammukhavartini pāre taṭe 'pi bahava uktavṛkṣā bhavanti /
analyzed: tathā vitastāyāḥ vijayeśvara sammukha vartini pāre taṭe bahavaḥ ukta vṛkṣāḥ bhavanti
translated: Similarly, on the other bank of the Vitasta facing Vijayeshvara, there are many of the above-mentioned trees.

original: vadanti ca janā etat vṛkṣaṣaṇḍavalitaṃ sthānadvayaṃ prācīnarājña upavanadvayam asti /
analyzed: vadanti ca janāḥ etat vṛkṣa ṣaṇḍa valitam sthāna dvayam prācīna rājñaḥ upavana dvayam asti
translated: People say that these two places surrounded by groves of trees were the two gardens of ancient kings.

original: anayor upavanayoḥ pādaśāhy bāg iti grāmīṇoktaṃ nāmāsti /
analyzed: anayoḥ upavanayoḥ bāc iti grāmīṇa uktam nāma asti
translated: These two gardens have a local name called Paadshahi Bagh.

original: tathāsya pradeśasya tanmatena vijyabhror iti nāma /
analyzed: tathā asya pradeśasya tad matena vijyabhroḥ iti nāma
translated: And according to their opinion, this region is called Vijjabro.

original: atra vijayeśvaranikaṭa eva nadyāḥ pārāvāragamanāya ekaḥ prataro 'pi bhavati /
analyzed: atra vijayeśvara nikaṭe eva nadyāḥ pārāvāra gamanāya ekaḥ bhavati
translated: Here, near Vijayeśvara itself, there is even a single bridge for going from one bank to the other of the river.

original: yasya vijyabhrori kadal iti vadanti /
analyzed: yasya kadal iti vadanti
translated: Of which they say, The bowstring of whose bow is the kadali plant.

original: atroktopavanabhūmau purācīne rājakṛtanirmāṇasya aikvaṣṭakādikam adyāpi darīdṛśyata iti śam //
analyzed: atra ukta upavana bhūmau purācīne rāja kṛta nirmāṇasya aikvaṣṭaka ādikam adya api darīdṛśyate iti śam
translated: In the garden described here, the foundation of bricks etc. made by the ancient king is still seen today. Thus, peace!

original: Ādikeśavaḥ
analyzed: ādikeśavaḥ
translated: Ādikeśava

original: ślokasaṃ nambara ādikeśavaḥ asya keśavasya niruktiḥ /
analyzed: ādikeśavaḥ asya keśavasya niruktiḥ
translated: The etymology of this Keśava is given in the verse number Ādikeśava.

original: kaṃ brahmāṇaṃ aṃ viṣṇuṃ īśaṃ śivam api yo vyāpnoti svasminn avabhāsakatvena tān avabhāsyamānāc chādayati sa keśavaḥ /
analyzed: kam brahmāṇam aṃ viṣṇum īśam śivam api yaḥ vyāpnoti svasmin avabhāsaka tvena tān avabhāsyamānāt chādayati sa keśavaḥ
translated: He who pervades Brahmā, Viṣṇu, and Īśa Śiva within himself by illuminating them and obscuring them as the illuminator, is Keśava.

original: tathā ca asya sarvasya jagataḥ sṛṣṭyāder ādāv api vartamāno yas sa ādikeśavaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca asya sarvasya jagataḥ sṛṣṭi ādeḥ ādau api vartamānaḥ yaḥ saḥ ādikeśavaḥ
translated: And thus, he who exists at the beginning of this entire creation etc. is Ādikeśava.

original: arthāj jagatsarjanapālanāntakaraṇādikarmakārī /
analyzed: arthāt jagat sarjana pālana anta karaṇa ādi karma kārī
translated: By implication, he is the performer of the acts of creating, maintaining, and destroying the world.

original: ādyaḥ sanātanaḥ paramātmā viṣṇur yo 'yaṃ sa evādikeśavapadābhidheyaḥ /
analyzed: ādyaḥ sanātanaḥ paramātmā viṣṇuḥ yaḥ yam saḥ eva ādikeśava pada abhidheyaḥ
translated: The primordial, eternal, supreme Self Viṣṇu, who is this, is designated by the word Ādikeśava.

original: sarvāsām asmin kaśmīramaṇḍale sthitānāṃ nānāvidhadevamūrtīnāṃ madhyā yasmād eṣaiva viṣṇor bhagavato mūrtir atrasthādyā bhavati /
analyzed: sarvāsām asmin kaśmīra maṇḍale sthitānām nānāvidha deva mūrtīnām madhyā yasmāt eṣā eva viṣṇoḥ bhagavataḥ mūrtiḥ atra sthā ādyā bhavati
translated: Among all the various forms of gods present in this region of Kashmir, this very form of Lord Vishnu, being the first, becomes the foremost.

original: ata evādikeśavapadavācyā sampannā /
analyzed: atas eva ādikeśava pada vācyā sampannā
translated: For this very reason, it has acquired the name Adya-avani.

original: asyaivādikeśavasya sadbhāvenāmuṣya puragaṇasyāpy ādyāvanir iti nāma saṃlagnam /
analyzed: asya eva ādikeśavasya sadbhāvena amuṣya pura gaṇasya api ādyā avaniḥ iti nāma saṃlagnam
translated: Due to the existence of this very Adhi-Keshava, this group of cities has also obtained the name Adya-avani.

original: tatrādyādau bhavā avanir bhūmir ity arthaḥ /🔽ādikeśavasya sthityā yata eṣaiva bhūmis sarvābhyo bhūmibhyo 'gragaṇyatāthāspadībhūtāta evādyāvanir iti sampannā /
analyzed: tatra ādi ādau bhavā avaniḥ bhūmiḥ iti arthaḥ  ādikeśavasya sthityā yatas eṣā eva bhūmiḥ sarvābhyaḥ bhūmibhyaḥ gragaṇyatā atha āspadībhūtā atas eva adyā avaniḥ iti sampannā
translated: There, the meaning is that the land is the first among all lands.🔽Since this very land is the foremost due to the presence of Adhi-Keshava, it has become the Adya-avani.

original: keṣāṃcin mate tu purāsyā bhuvaḥ satīsarorūpāvasthāyāṃ yadāmbhobhir eva sarvataḥ procchaladbhir
analyzed: keṣāṃcid mate tu purā asyāḥ bhuvaḥ satī saraḥ rūpa avasthāyām yadā ambhobhiḥ eva sarvatas procchaladbhiḥ
translated: But according to some, when this land was in the form of a lake in the past, it was always covered by waters that were overflowing in all directions,🔽having the variations of water such as whirlpools and eddies,

original: āvartapuṭabhedādijalavikṛtiśālibhis sadaiva nadīmātṛkatvadeśaguṇasampattyā saraḥparipūrayadbhir
analyzed: āvarta puṭa bheda ādi jala vikṛti śālibhiḥ sadā eva nadīmātṛka tva deśa guṇa sampattyā saraḥ paripūrayadbhiḥ
translated: and filling the lake with the quality of being the mother of rivers.

original: evāyaṃ bhāgaḥ samākrāṃta āsīt tadā kaśyaparṣitapovibhūtisantuṣṭadevagaṇaprasādena
analyzed: eva ayam bhāgaḥ samākrāṃtaḥ āsīt tadā kaśyapa ṛṣi tapaḥ vibhūti santuṣṭa deva gaṇa prasādena
translated: At that time, by the grace of the group of gods satisfied by the power of the penance of the sage Kashyapa,

original: jalasya deśanivasanamaṇḍalasthāpanādyarthaṃ sthalarūpatāsampādanakāle bhūmitvaprakaṭībhāve
analyzed: jalasya deśa nivasana maṇḍala sthāpana ādi artham sthala rūpa tā sampādana kāle bhūmi tva prakaṭībhāve
translated: When the water is being made into a land form for the purpose of establishing the regions and countries, at the time of manifesting the earth nature,

original: 'traivādyāvanau bhūmitvaṃ yadṛggocarībhūtam /
analyzed: traiva ādya avanau bhūmi tvam yadṛc gocarībhūtam
translated: the earth nature is manifested here in the primordial land.

original: ata evāsya puragaṇasyādyāvanitvena vyapadeśa ityādy apy asti /
analyzed: atas eva asya pura gaṇasya ādya avani tvena vyapadeśaḥ ityādi api asti
translated: For this very reason, this city is designated as the primordial land, so there is also the primordial.

original: tatrādyāvanipadasya ādau bhavād yā sā cāsau bhūmir ādyabhūmir ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ādya avani padasya ādau bhavāt yā sā ca asau bhūmiḥ ādya bhūmiḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: There, the meaning of the word primordial land is the land that exists at the beginning, and the primordial land is the land that exists at the beginning.

original: vartate cātrādyāvanipuragaṇe 'nena nāmnākhyāta eko jalāśayaḥ yasya keśavapadavācyasyākṛtir adhunetthaṃ dṛśyate /
analyzed: vartate ca atra adya avanipura gaṇe nena nāmnā ākhyātaḥ ekaḥ jalāśayaḥ yasya keśava pada vācyasya ākṛtiḥ adhunā ittham dṛśyate
translated: And in this primordial city, there is a lake known by this name, the form of which is now seen thus.

original: uparitane bhāge vistṛtākṛtis tathādhastane bhāge saṃkocamuktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: uparitane bhāge vistṛta ākṛtiḥ tathā adhastane bhāge saṃkoca muktam bhavati
translated: In the upper part, the form is extended, and in the lower part, it is said to be contracted.

original: ayaṃ jalāśayaḥ pūrvavarṇitasandhyādevījalāśaya iva vartulākāro bhavati /
analyzed: ayam jalāśayaḥ pūrva varṇita sandhyādevī jalāśayaḥ iva vartula ākāraḥ bhavati
translated: This lake is round in shape, like the lake of the goddess Sandhya described earlier.

original: grāmīṇās tv etarhy asya grāmasya ghaṭāyam ādikeśavamūrtir jalāśayo vartate tasya grāmasya phrasal iti nāma bruvāṇā bhavanti /
analyzed: grāmīṇāḥ tu etarhi asya grāmasya ghaṭa ayam ādikeśavamūrtiḥ jalāśayaḥ vartate tasya grāmasya phrasal iti nāma bruvāṇāḥ bhavanti
translated: But the villagers now say that the lake in the form of the primordial Keshava exists for the sake of the pot of this village, and they say that the name of that village is Phrasal.

original: punaś cāsya puragaṇasya yatrāyaṃ grāmas tasya puragaṇasya āḍvin iti nāma vadanti /
analyzed: punar ca asya pura gaṇasya yatra ayam grāmaḥ tasya pura gaṇasya āḍvin iti nāma vadanti
translated: And again, they say that the name of the city group where this village is located is Āḍvin.

original: asya jalāśayasyāpi keśavanāg iti tadbhāṣayā khyātaṃ nāmāsti /
analyzed: asya jalāśayasya api keśavanāc iti tat bhāṣayā khyātam nāma asti
translated: And this pond also has a well-known name in that language, Keśavanāg.

original: tatra keśavasyāsyaivādikeśavasya nāg jalāśaya ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tatra keśavasya asya eva ādikeśavasya nāc jalāśayaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: There, the meaning is that this very Keśava is the original Keśava, and the pond is Nāg.

original: yataḥ kaśmīradeśe ye ye sarve jalāśayās te te nāgpadābhidheyā eva bhavanti /
analyzed: yatas kaśmīra deśe ye ye sarve jalāśayāḥ te te nāgpada abhidheyāḥ eva bhavanti
translated: Because in the Kashmir region, all the ponds are indeed designated by the word Nāg.

original: asya phrasal iti khyātasya grāmasya nikaṭe 'nyo 'pi grāmo bhavati /
analyzed: asya phrasal iti khyātasya grāmasya nikaṭe grāmaḥ bhavati
translated: Near this well-known village Phra-sal, there is another village.

original: tasya ārvañ iti nāmāsti /
analyzed: tasya ārvam iti nāma asti
translated: It has the name Ārvam.

original: ataḥ kecana grāmīṇāḥ phrasal ārvañ iti samastam api kathayanti nāma /
analyzed: atas kecana grāmīṇāḥ phrasal ārvaṃ iti samastam api kathayanti nāma
translated: Therefore, some villagers also say the combined name is Phra-sal Ārvam.

original: asya jalāśayasyāspadībhūta āḍvinpuragaṇo devasarpuragaṇād adhastane bhūbhāge vartamāno bhavatīti //
analyzed: asya jalāśayasya āspadībhūtaḥ āḍvinpura gaṇaḥ devasarpura gaṇāt adhastane bhū bhāge vartamānaḥ bhavati iti
translated: The city group Āḍvin, which serves as the basis for this pond, is located on the lower ground from the city group Devasar.

original: Īśānaḥ
analyzed: īśānaḥ
translated: Isana

original: ślokasaṃ nambara īśānaḥ /
analyzed: ślokasam nambaraḥ īśānaḥ
translated: The number of verses is Īśāna.

original: sarvasmiñ jagati īṣṭe aiśvaryaṃ yaḥ karoti sa īśānaḥ /
analyzed: sarvasmin jagati īṣṭe aiśvaryam yaḥ karoti saḥ īśānaḥ
translated: He who desires and creates lordship in the entire world is Īśāna.

original: sarvadevagaṇādhipati lokavarti sampacchāli aiśvaryam īhamāno yaḥ śivaḥ sarvarddhīnāṃ bhūtīnāṃ samastānāṃ prabhuś ca sa īśānapadābhidheyaḥ /
analyzed: sarva deva gaṇa adhipati loka varti sampad śāli aiśvaryam īhamānaḥ yaḥ śivaḥ sarva ṛddhīnām bhūtīnām samastānām prabhuḥ ca saḥ īśāna pada abhidheyaḥ
translated: The lord of all hosts of gods, ruling the world, desiring prosperity and sovereignty, that auspicious one, the master of all prosperities and all perfections, is designated by the word Īśāna.

original: śiveśānayoḥ padayor ekaparyāyatvena varṇyamānapradeśasthaiṣā śivamūrtir ity arthaḥ /🔽atha vā kalhaṇapaṇḍitakṛtarājataraṅgiṇīdvitīyataraṅgavarṇyamānasandhimān sandhimatiś
analyzed: śiva īśānayoḥ padayoḥ eka paryāya tvena varṇyamāna pradeśa sthā eṣā śiva mūrtiḥ iti arthaḥ  atha vā kalhaṇa paṇḍita kṛta rājataraṅgiṇī dvitīya taraṅga varṇyamāna sandhimān sandhi matiḥ
translated: The meaning is that this form of Śiva is located in the region described as being synonymous with the words Śiva and Īśāna.🔽Or, the teacher of King Sāntimati, who was described in the second wave of the Rājatarangiṇī composed by the scholar Kalhaṇa,

original: cety ākhyasya rājño yo gurur yasya prasādāt tena mṛtenāpi rājñā sandhimatinā punarjīvitaṃ
analyzed: ca iti ākhyasya rājñaḥ yaḥ guruḥ yasya prasādāt tena mṛtena api rājñā sandhimatinā punar jīvitam
translated: by whose grace the dead king Sāntimati was revived again,

original: samākalitaṃ sa eva īśānanāmā yatas tadākhyayāpy atrasthaiṣā śivamūrtir īśānapadavācyā saṃjātā /
analyzed: samākalitam saḥ eva īśāna nāmā yatas tad ākhyayā api atra sthā eṣā śiva mūrtiḥ īśāna pada vācyā saṃjātā
translated: that very one named Īśāna, since this form of Śiva located here became designated by the word Īśāna due to that name.

original: tathā ca kalhaṇarājataraṅgiṇīdvitīyataraṅgasyaikaśatādhike saptatriṃśattame śloke🔽kṛtvā sandhīśvaraṃ dehasandhānapitṛkānane /
analyzed: tathā ca kalhaṇa rājataraṅgiṇī dvitīya taraṅgasya ekaśata adhike saptatriṃśattame śloke  kṛtvā sandhīśvaram deha sandhāna pitṛ kānane
translated: And in the thirty-seventh verse exceeding one hundred of the second wave of Kalhaṇa's Rājatarangiṇī,🔽Having made Īśvara in the forest of the father of bodily union,

original: īśānasya guror nāmnā vyadhād īśeśvaraṃ haram //
analyzed: īśānasya guroḥ nāmnā vyadhāt īśa īśvaram haram
translated: he established Īśeśvara Hara by the name of the teacher Īśāna.

original: īśeśvara iti nāmnākhyāto 'pi bhaktasya tasyaiveśānasya nāmnā prakhyātim āgataḥ /
analyzed: īśeśvaraḥ iti nāmnā ākhyātaḥ u pi bhaktasya tasya eva īśānasya nāmnā prakhyātim āgataḥ
translated: Although known by the name of Ishana, he became famous by the name of Ishana, the devotee's Ishana.

original: yadi apy e / / / śānakālāt pūrvam api śivamūrtiprākaṭyenātra pradeśe 'tipūtatvātimāhātmyavattvaṃ🔽cāsīd eva tathāpi īśānasyevāticitrīyamāṇacaritraprākaṭyakaraṇavaśataḥ sarvathaiva
analyzed: yadi api śāna kālāt pūrvam api śiva mūrti prākaṭyena atra pradeśe ti pūta tva ati māhātmyavat tvam  ca āsīt eva tathā api īśānasya iva ati citrīyamāṇa caritra prākaṭya karaṇa vaśataḥ sarvathā eva
translated: Even though before the time of Ishana, this place was already extremely pure and great due to the manifestation of Shiva's form,

original: khyātimattvaṃ sampannam /
analyzed: khyātimat tvam sampannam
translated: nevertheless, due to the manifestation of extremely wonderful conduct like that of Ishana, it became completely famous.

original: atra dvitīyataraṅge pañcādhikaṃ ṣaṣṭitamaṃ ślokam ārabhya varṇanīyo yo jayendrākhyo
analyzed: atra dvitīya taraṅge pañca adhikam ṣaṣṭitamam ślokam ārabhya varṇanīyaḥ yaḥ jayendra ākhyaḥ
translated: Here, in the second wave, starting from the sixty-fifth verse, the one to be described is the king named Jayendra,

original: rājño vijayasya putras tasyaivāyaṃ sandhimatir nāmā īśānasya śiṣyo mantrī matimaduttamo pūrvaṃ babhūva /🔽atha bhūtaṃ puruṣās taṃ capalakarṇaṃ mattakariṇam iva rājānam ayaṃ sandhimatir bhavanmantry
analyzed: rājñaḥ vijayasya putraḥ tasya eva ayam sandhimatiḥ nāmā īśānasya śiṣyaḥ mantrī pūrvam babhūva  atha bhūtam puruṣāḥ tam capala karṇam matta kariṇam iva rājānam ayam sandhi matiḥ bhavat mantrī
translated: the son of King Vijaya. This very Sandhimati, his disciple and minister, was previously the best of the wise.

original: atyadbhutam ativaibhavavān sarvathaivāsty ato 'smād rājyaharaṇādiśaṃkāvaśyaṃ vidheyetyādi kathayām āsuḥ /
analyzed: ati adbhutam ati vaibhavavān sarvathā evā asti atas smāt rājya haraṇa ādi śaṃkā avaśyam vidheyā ityādi kathayām āsuḥ
translated: Then the people told him, This Sandhimati, your minister, is extremely wonderful and very powerful in every way. Therefore, the suspicion of the seizure of the kingdom must be entertained.

original: asmād eva hetor anena bhūtaṃ vañcitena rājñā tasmin buddhimantriṇy api vairabuddhiḥ kopena samyaktam ākalitā /🔽atha tadvairavismāritatatprītis sa rājā svasabhāpraveśanivāraṇapūrvakaṃ tatsarvasvāpaharaṇapūrvakaṃ ca taṃ mantriṇam ahetukam eva yāvajjīvaṃ
analyzed: asmāt eva hetoḥ anena bhūtam vañcitena rājñā tasmin buddhi mantriṇi api vaira buddhiḥ kopena samyak tam ākalitā  atha tad vaira vismārita tad prītiḥ sa rājā sva sabhā praveśa nivāraṇa pūrvakam tad sarva sva apaharaṇa pūrvakam ca tam mantriṇam ahetukam eva yāvajjīvam
translated: For this very reason, the king, deceived by him, though he was a wise minister, rightly considered him with anger as an enemy.

original: daridratām anayat /🔽etādṛśīṃ duravasthām āpto 'pi sa mantrī tat svasya rājyakāryādibhraṃśaṃ pratyūharahitaśivapūjāvasaralābhena vyathākāri nājñāsīt /
analyzed: daridra tām anayat  etādṛśīm duravasthām sa mantrī tat svasya rājya kārya ādi bhraṃśam pratyūha rahita śiva pūjā avasara lābhena vyathā kāri nā ajñāsīt
translated: Then, forgetting his affection for him due to his enmity, the king, first preventing him from entering his court, and first confiscating all his wealth, made that minister poor for no reason at all for the rest of his life.🔽Even though he had fallen into such a bad state, that minister, due to the opportunity of performing auspicious worship free from obstacles, did not realize the loss of his own kingdom and duties as a cause of distress.

original: atha bhāvino 'rthasya balavattayā sandhimater eva rājyaṃ bhaviṣyatīdṛśy eva vāṇī prativeśmākasmāt prakhyātiṃ prāptā /
analyzed: atha bhāvinaḥ ṛthasya balavat tayā sandhi mateḥ eva rājyam bhaviṣyati īdṛśī eva vāṇī prativeśma akasmāt prakhyātim prāptā
translated: Then, by the power of future events, the statement The kingdom will belong to Sandhimati alone became well-known in every house, as if it had not been heard.

original: tathā ca dvitīyataraṅgasya catussaptatitame śloke
analyzed: tathā ca dvitīya taraṅgasya catussaptatitame śloke
translated: And in the seventy-fourth verse of the second wave:

original: atha bhāvyarthamāhātmyāt paprathe pratimandiram /
analyzed: atha bhāvi artha māhātmyāt paprathe pratimandiram
translated: Then, by the greatness of future events, it spread to every house.

original: rājyaṃ sandhimater bhāvīty aśrutāpi sarasvatī //
analyzed: rājyam sandhimateḥ bhāvi iti a śrutā api sarasvatī
translated: The kingdom will belong to Sandhimati, even though not heard, Sarasvati (the goddess of speech) proclaimed it.

original: tataś ca sa rājā pūrvoktāyā etādṛśyā vāṇyāḥ śravaṇenākasmād īdṛśī vāṇī nava pracaraty
analyzed: tatas ca sa rājā pūrva uktāyāḥ etādṛśyāḥ vāṇyāḥ śravaṇena akasmāt īdṛśī vāṇī nava pracarati
translated: Then, the king, hearing such a voice as was mentioned before, suddenly such a voice was heard,

original: ato devādipreritaivāvaśyaṃ bhavatīti jñātvā ca samutpannamahābhītis taṃ maṃtriṇaṃ
analyzed: atas deva ādi preritā evā avaśyam bhavati iti jñātvā ca samutpanna mahā bhītiḥ tam maṃtriṇam
translated: Therefore, knowing that it must be caused by gods and others, and having great fear arisen, he🔽put that minister

original: kārāgṛhe sthāpayām āsa /
analyzed: kārā gṛhe sthāpayām āsa
translated: in prison.

original: tatra tasyogranigaḍapīḍitapādasyāta eva śoṣaṃ prāptasya daśavarṣāṇi pūrṇatām īyuḥ /
analyzed: tatra tasya ugra nigaḍa pīḍita pādasya atas eva śoṣam prāptasya daśa varṣāṇi pūrṇa tām īyuḥ
translated: There, his feet being severely afflicted by fetters, he became emaciated just because of that, and ten years passed.

original: tāny eva daśavarṣāṇi sandhimatisvāmino 'sya jayendrasya rājña āyuḥ śeṣasyāvadhi bhūtāny
analyzed: tāni eva daśa varṣāṇi jaya indrasya rājñaḥ āyuḥ śeṣasya avadhi bhūtāni
translated: Those very ten years became the limit of the remaining life of this king Jayendra, the lord of Sandhimati.

original: athāsanathāputramararogakṛtapīḍas tasya mātreṇa ścintayā ca kṛtātipīḍāte eva mumūrṣarantar
analyzed: tasya mātreṇa ca eva mumūrṣa rantar
translated: Then, afflicted by the disease caused by the death of his son, and greatly afflicted by his mother's grief, he himself was on the verge of death.

original: eva mahāntaṃ dāham āsasāda /
analyzed: eva mahāntam dāham āsasāda
translated: He himself experienced great burning.

original: ittham eva tena mantrividveṣajvalanenāharniśaṃ jvalatā tāpyamānas sa bhūpo tasya mantriṇo vadhaṃ vinā bhavitavyapratīkāraṃ kim api na mene
analyzed: ittham eva tena mantri vidveṣa jvalanena aharniśam jvalatā tāpyamānaḥ sa bhūpaḥ tasya mantriṇaḥ vadham vinā bhavitavya pratīkāram kim api na mene
translated: In this way, being tormented day and night by that blazing fire of hatred for the minister, the king did not think of any remedy except for the death of that minister.

original: aho paṇḍitam manyāḥ pumāṃso asya bhāvino 'rthasya gopanāya yaṃ kaṃcanopāyaṃ vidadhati sa evopāya nivāritaṃ hāraṃ daivena tasyārthasya kalpate
analyzed: aho paṇḍitam manyāḥ pumāṃsaḥ asya bhāvinaḥ rthasya gopanāya yam kaṃcana upāyam vidadhati saḥ eva upāya nivāritam hāram daivena tasya arthasya kalpate
translated: Oh, how clever men think they are! They devise some means to conceal this future event, but that very means, when prevented by fate, becomes the means for that event.

original: yathā daivaṃ svājñayā kāṣṭhavṛndasthasya stokatejaso 'py agnikaṇasya nirupamāṃ śaktim ādhātuṃ icchati /
analyzed: yathā daivam sva ājñayā kāṣṭha vṛnda sthasya stoka tejasaḥ api agni kaṇasya nirupamām śaktim ādhātum icchati
translated: Just as fate, by its own will, desires to bestow incomparable power on even a tiny spark of fire in a heap of wood.

original: tadā tasya mahatīm eva śaktim ādhāsyamānasyoktāgnikaṇasya nirvāpaṇaṃ yaḥ kaścana🔽daivabalam ajānataḥ kartum īheta tasya tad daivaṃ tāpagalitaghṛtayute ghṛtakumbhe
analyzed: tadā tasya mahatīm eva śaktim ādhāsyamānasya ukta agni kaṇasya nirvāpaṇam yaḥ kaścana  daiva balam a jānataḥ kartum īheta tasya tat daivam tāpa galita ghṛta yute ghṛta kumbhe
translated: Then, when it is about to bestow great power on that mentioned spark of fire, someone tries to extinguish it,

original: vārikumbhabhramaṃ karoti /
analyzed: vāri kumbha bhramam karoti
translated: not knowing the power of fate. For that fate makes a pot of water whirl in a pot of ghee melted by heat.

original: atha yadaiva rājñā mantrighātāya vadhakarmādhikāriṇaḥ samādiṣṭāḥ tadaiva sa sandhimatis taiḥ śūlaṃ samāropya hanyate sma /
analyzed: atha yadā eva rājñā mantri ghātāya vadha karma adhikāriṇaḥ samādiṣṭāḥ tadā eva sa sandhimatiḥ taiḥ śūlam samāropya hanyate sma
translated: Then, just when the king ordered the executioners to kill him for the murder of the minister, at that very moment Sandhimati was impaled on a stake and killed by them.

original: tato 'pi tasmin mantriṇi śūlaṃ prote sati tasya rājña ādau sa mantricintād duḥkhaśaṅkur niragacchat /
analyzed: tatas pi tasmin mantriṇi śūlam prote sati tasya rājñaḥ ādau sa mantri cintāt duḥkha śaṅkuḥ niragacchat
translated: Then, even when that minister was impaled on the stake, that king first lost the dart of sorrow from thinking about the minister.

original: paścāj jīvitam api nirjagāma /
analyzed: paścāt jīvitam api nirjagāma
translated: Afterwards, he lost his life as well.

original: atha tathāhatasya svakīyaśiṣyasya vadhaṃ śrutvā vaśino 'pīśānābhidhasya tadguror mano 'ntastaptaṃ babhūva /
analyzed: atha tathā āhatasya svakīya śiṣyasya vadham śrutvā pi īśāna abhidhasya tad guroḥ manaḥ ntar taptam babhūva
translated: Then, hearing of the death of his own disciple, even the mind of the teacher named Ishana, though powerful, was heated within.

original: atha eva tasya vinītasya śiṣyasyāntakālīno citasatkriyākarmaṇe sa īśāno yasyāṃ bhuvi sandhimati mṛtyur abhūt tām eva śmaśānabhuvam ājagāma
analyzed: atha eva tasya vinītasya śiṣyasya anta kālīnaḥ cita satkriyā karmaṇe saḥ īśānaḥ yasyām bhuvi sandhimati mṛtyuḥ abhūt tām eva śmaśāna bhuvam ājagāma
translated: Then, for the funeral rites of that well-disciplined disciple, that Ishana went to that very cremation ground where the death of Sandhima occurred.

original: tatra sa īśānas taṃ svaśiṣyaṃ tasminn eva śūlamūle 'vaṣṭabdhvāsthiśakalam adhastād vṛkair balāt kṛṣyamāṇām asthiśeṣam eva dadarśa /
analyzed: tatra saḥ īśānaḥ tam sva śiṣyam tasmin eva śūla mūle vaṣṭabdhvā asthiśakalam adhastāt vṛkaiḥ balāt kṛṣyamāṇām asthi śeṣam eva dadarśa
translated: There, that Ishana, having seized the fragment of bone at the very foot of the stake, saw only the remaining bones being forcibly dragged by wolves below.

original: dṛṣṭā ca samahatātiśokena hā vatsedṛśīṃ tvad avasthām eva draṣṭuṃ jīvāmīty uktā tasmiñ śūle protaṃ kaṅkālaṃ vāśato vṛkāt nivārayan sa nināya
analyzed: dṛṣṭā ca samahatā ati śokena hā vatsa īdṛśīm tvat avasthām eva draṣṭum jīvāmi iti uktā tasmin śūle protam kaṅkālam vāśataḥ vṛkāt nivārayan sa nināya
translated: And having seen it, with great sorrow, saying Alas, child! I live only to see you in this state, he, preventing the wolves from tearing the skeleton hanging on the stake, took it away.

original: athocitaṃ saṃskāram antimaṃ kartuṃ yāvat sa īśānaḥ samudyatas tāvat asya svaśiṣyasya lalāṭapaṭṭe daivalikhitam idaṃ ślokaṃ papāṭha /
analyzed: atha ucitam saṃskāram antimam kartum yāvat saḥ īśānaḥ samudyataḥ tāvat asya sva śiṣyasya lalāṭa paṭṭe daiva likhitam idam ślokam papāṭha
translated: Then, when Ishana was ready to perform the proper final rites, he recited this verse written by fate on the forehead of his own disciple:

original: tadyathā /
analyzed: tat yathā
translated: Namely:

original: yāvajjīvaṃ daridratvaṃ daśa varṣāṇi bandhanam /
analyzed: yāvajjīvam daridra tvam daśa varṣāṇi bandhanam
translated: Poverty for life, ten years in prison,

original: śūlasya pṛṣṭe maraṇaṃ punā rājyaṃ bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: śūlasya pṛṣṭe maraṇam rājyam bhaviṣyati
translated: Death by impalement, and then kingship will come.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: tataś ca sa gurur asyoktaślokapādatrayasya yathārthatayā jñātārtho 'taś caturthapādārthe 'vaśyadraṣṭavye kautukānvito bhūtvā manasi katham
analyzed: tatas ca sa guruḥ asya ukta śloka pāda trayasya yathārtha tayā caturtha pāda arthe vaśya draṣṭavye kautuka anvitaḥ bhūtvā manasi katham
translated: Then that teacher, having understood the meaning of the three quarters of the verse as it is, and therefore, when the meaning of the fourth quarter must be seen, becoming full of curiosity, thought in his mind:

original: ivaitad bhaviṣyatīty acintayat /
analyzed: iva etat bhaviṣyati iti acintayat
translated: How will this be?

original: atha sadaiva śaktim acintyaprabhāvāṃ yayā pūrvam arjunaparīkṣitkacādayo mṛtāḥ santaḥ
analyzed: atha sadā eva śaktim acintya prabhāvām yayā pūrvam arjuna parīkṣit kaca ādayaḥ mṛtāḥ santaḥ
translated: Then he always considered that inconceivable power by which Arjuna, Parikshit, Kacha and others, having died before,

original: punarjīvitaṃ prāptās tām evāghaṭyamānaghaṭakāṃ vicārya devaṃ sarvasiddhiṣu nirnirodham
analyzed: punar jīvitam prāptāḥ tām eva a ghaṭyamāna ghaṭakām vicārya devam sarva siddhiṣu nirnirodham
translated: attained life again, that very power which is not made by anyone, and having praised the god who is unobstructed in all accomplishments,

original: atipragalbhaṃ stutvā bhāvino 'rthasya siddhidarśanāyodyatas tasminn eva śmaśāne kṛtavasatis
analyzed: ati pragalbham stutvā bhāvinaḥ rthasya siddhi darśanāya udyataḥ tasmin eva śmaśāne kṛta vasatiḥ
translated: being very bold, in order to show the accomplishment of future goals, he made his dwelling in that very cremation ground,

original: taṃ tasya kaṅkālaṃ rarakṣa /
analyzed: tam tasya kaṅkālam rarakṣa
translated: and guarded his skeleton.

original: athaikadā niśīthe tayaivāścaryacintayā jāgran sa īśānaḥ pūrvaṃ divyadhūpagandham akasmād āghrāya ḍamarugharāṭādinānāvādyānāṃ dhvaniṃ śuśrāva
analyzed: athā ekadā niśīthe tayā eva āścarya cintayā jāgran saḥ īśānaḥ pūrvam divya dhūpa gandham akasmāt āghrāya ḍamaru gharāṭa ādi nānā vādyānām dhvanim śuśrāva
translated: Then one day, while awake at midnight with that very wonder-thinking, that Lord first smelled the fragrance of divine incense all of a sudden, and heard the sounds of various musical instruments such as damaru, gharaṭa, etc.

original: tataḥ sa śabdaṃ śrutvaiva yāvat tamo 'rim udghaṭyamānaḥ paśyati tāvad eva tena tejomaṇḍalavirājamānaṃ yoginīcakraṃ tasyāṃ pitṛvanabhūmau samāgataṃ
analyzed: tatas sa śabdam śrutvā eva yāvat udghaṭyamānaḥ paśyati tāvat eva tena tejaḥ maṇḍala virājamānam yoginī cakram tasyām pitṛvana bhūmau samāgatam
translated: Then, having heard that sound, as soon as he opened the door to the darkness, he saw that very circle of yoginīs shining with a halo of light gathered on that cremation ground.

original: dṛṣṭam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭam
translated: It was seen.

original: atha tābhir yoginībhir yāvad eva tat asya kaṅkālam apavāsyate tāvad eva bhītasya tasya gurur dhṛtakhaḍgas tāṃ śmaśanabhūmim āgacchat /
analyzed: atha tābhiḥ yoginībhiḥ yāvat eva tat asya kaṅkālam apavāsyate tāvat eva bhītasya tasya guruḥ dhṛta khaḍgaḥ tām śmaśana bhūmim āgacchat
translated: Then, as soon as those yoginīs were removing his skeleton, his frightened guru came to that cremation ground with a sword drawn.

original: āgatya sa vṛkṣacchannas tair yoginīgaṇais saṃpujyamānasamastāvayavam ata eva maṇḍale śāyitaṃ taṃ kaṅkālaṃ paśyati sma /
analyzed: āgatya sa vṛkṣa channaḥ taiḥ yoginī gaṇaiḥ saṃpujyamāna samasta avayavam atas eva maṇḍale śāyitam tam kaṅkālam paśyati sma
translated: Having come, he saw that very skeleton lying in a circle, all its limbs worshipped by those groups of yoginīs hidden by trees.

original: tābhir madirāpāpidevatābhir yoginībhir uttamavarasaṃyogakāminībhir yadānyo varaḥ ko 'pi na labdhas tadā sa eva kaṅkālo tviṣyāpasyataḥ /
analyzed: tābhiḥ madirā pāpi devatābhiḥ yoginībhiḥ uttama vara saṃyoga kāminībhiḥ yadā anyaḥ varaḥ na labdhaḥ tadā saḥ eva
translated: When those yoginīs, who are fond of the highest union, did not obtain any other boon, then that very skeleton was desired by him, who was looking on.

original: atha tāḥ svam ekam ekam aṅgaṃ kṣaṇād eva tasmin saṃsthāpya kuto 'pi puruṣalakṣmyāpy ānīya taṃ pūrṇāṅgaṃ cakruḥ /
analyzed: atha tāḥ svam ekam ekam aṅgam kṣaṇāt eva tasmin saṃsthāpya kutas pi puruṣa lakṣmyā api ānīya tam pūrṇa aṅgam cakruḥ
translated: Then, in an instant, they each gave him one of their own limbs, and from somewhere they brought the beauty of a man and made him whole.

original: punaś ca yoginyo yad anākrāntānyavigrahaṃ puryaṣṭakam ata eva bhrāmyat tad eva yogabalena kuto'py ākṛṣya tasya sandhimateḥ kaṃkasya sthāpayām
analyzed: punar ca yoginyaḥ yat an ākrānta anya vigraham puryaṣṭakam atas eva bhrāmyat tat eva yoga balena kutopi ākṛṣya tasya sandhimateḥ kaṃkasya sthāpayām
translated: And again, the yoginīs, by the power of yoga, drew from somewhere the puryaṣṭaka, the body of the eight [subtle] substances, which had not been affected by other [bodies], and which was therefore wandering, and placed it in the body of that Saṃdhimati Kaṅka.

original: āsuḥ /
analyzed: āsuḥ
translated: They made it so.

original: tataḥ sa sandhimatiḥ suptaprabuddha iva tābhir dattadivyāṅgarāgaś cakranāyakatvam ādadhānas tābhis saha yatheṣṭasambhogādilābhavān babhūva
analyzed: tatas sa sandhimatiḥ supta prabuddhaḥ iva tābhiḥ datta divya aṅga rāgaḥ cakranāyaka tvam ādadhānaḥ tābhiḥ saha yatheṣṭa sambhoga ādi lābhavān babhūva
translated: Then, like one awakened from sleep, he, having been given divine unguents by them, and establishing himself as the leader of the wheel, enjoyed with them as he wished and so on.

original: atha prabhātībhūtāyāṃ rātrau sa īśānas tadyoginīdattāṅgādivibhāgaṃ punar api nīyamānam
analyzed: atha prabhātībhūtāyām rātrau saḥ īśānaḥ tad yoginī datta aṅga ādi vibhāgam punar api nīyamānam
translated: Then, in the night that had become bright, that Īśāna, fearing that the division of the limbs and so on given by those yoginīs would again be taken away,

original: āśaṅkabhītaḥ saṃs tadrakṣārthaṃ dhīras sann ata eva nadaś ca tad eva sthānaṃ yāvad
analyzed: āśaṅka bhītaḥ san tad rakṣā artham dhīraḥ san atas eva nadaḥ ca tat eva sthānam yāvat
translated: being wise and afraid of that, he, from just that, roared and went to that very place.

original: eva samāgacchati tāvad eva tadyoginīvṛndaṃ kṣipram eva 'tirohitam /
analyzed: eva samāgacchati tāvat eva tat yoginī vṛndam kṣipram eva tirohitam
translated: As soon as he arrived, that group of yoginīs quickly disappeared.

original: tāsāṃ cāntarhitānāṃ yoginīnāṃ tenetthaṃ vāṇy api śrutā he īśāna tava bhayaṃ māstu /
analyzed: tāsām ca antarhitānām yoginīnām tena ittham vāṇī api śrutā he īśāna tava bhayam mā astu
translated: And the hidden Yoginis heard this voice: O Ishana, let there be no fear for you.

original: yato 'smākam anena karmaṇām aṅgahānir nāsti /
analyzed: yatas smākam anena karmaṇām aṅga hāniḥ na asti
translated: Because by this act of ours, there is no loss of limbs for us.

original: asmin bate vañcanāpi nāsti /
analyzed: asmin bate vañcanā api na asti
translated: And there is no deception in this.

original: pratyutāyam asmad varād divyaśarīreṇa sandhīyamāno 'taḥ sandhimannāmā rājā punaś cāryatayā āryarājākhyayā bhuvi khyato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: pratyuta ayam asmat varāt divya śarīreṇa sandhīyamānaḥ sandhimat nāmā rājā punar ca ārya tayā ārya rāja ākhyayā bhuvi khyataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: On the contrary, he, being united with a divine body by our boon, will be known on earth as King Sandhiman, due to having a joint, and again as King Aryaraja, due to his noble nature.

original: tataś ca sa sandhimatir divyāṃśuko divyabhūṣaṇaḥ sragvī labdhapūrvasmṛtiś ca prahvībhūya taṃ svaguruṃ vavande /
analyzed: tatas ca sa sandhi matiḥ divya aṃśukaḥ divya bhūṣaṇaḥ sragvī labdha pūrva smṛtiḥ ca prahvībhūya tam sva gurum vavande
translated: Then that Sandhiman, with a divine garment, divine ornaments, and a garland, and having regained his former memory, became humble and bowed to his own Guru.

original: atha sa rājā tena guruṇā saha saṃsārasyāsāratāyāś cittatāyāś ca kathāṃ kṛtvā tad
analyzed: atha sa rājā tena guruṇā saha saṃsārasya asāra tāyāḥ citta tāyāḥ ca kathām kṛtvā tat
translated: Then that king, having had a conversation with that Guru about the insubstantiality of worldly existence and the state of mind,

original: anumanyaiva katham api kṛccheṇa niḥspṛho rājyapālanam anumatavān itītthaṃ varṇito
analyzed: anumanya eva katham api kṛccheṇa niḥspṛhaḥ rājya pālanam anumatavān iti ittham
translated: and with his permission, somehow with difficulty, became disinterested and allowed the governance of the kingdom. Thus it is described

original: yo guros tasyānirvācyopakārasya vāsya varṇyamāneśeśvareti khyātapradeśasya nirmityādau mukhyo hetuḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ guroḥ tasya anirvācya upakārasya vā asya varṇyamāna īśa īśvara iti khyāta pradeśasya nirmiti ādau mukhyaḥ hetuḥ
translated: that he, who is the main cause in the creation etc. of the region known as Varnyamane Ishvara, of that Guru whose help is inexpressible,

original: yady api pūrvam atrastho 'pi mahādevābhidhaḥ śivo 'bhūt tathāpi tasyeśānasyaiva nāmnādyāpi khyātimatvaṃ bhajate /
analyzed: yadi api pūrvam mahādeva abhidhaḥ śivaḥ bhūt tathā api tasya īśānasya eva nāmnā adya api khyātimatvam bhajate
translated: Although in the past, even while residing here, Śiva was called Mahādeva, still, even today, it is known by the name of that Īśāna alone.

original: asya pradeśasyādhunā guptagaṅgā iti nāma sarvajagatkhyātaṃ bhavati /🔽tatra mahādevena gaṅgā yato guptāgopiteti yāvat atas sārthakaṃ guptagaṅgeti nāma etat /
analyzed: asya pradeśasya adhunā guptagaṅgā iti nāma sarva jagat khyātam bhavati  tatra mahādevena gaṅgā yatas guptā ā gopitā iti yāvat atas sārthakam guptagaṅgā iti nāma etat
translated: Now, this region has become famous in the entire world under the name of Guptagangā.🔽There, since the Ganges was hidden, concealed, by Mahādeva, this name Guptagangā is meaningful.

original: pradeśanikaṭasthamahādevākhyagirim ārūḍhena mahādevena gopitā gaṅgā prativatsaraṃ
analyzed: pradeśa nikaṭa stha mahādeva ākhya girim ārūḍhena mahādevena gopitā gaṅgā prati vatsaram
translated: The Ganges, hidden by Mahādeva, who ascended the mountain called Mahādeva located near this region, every year

original: vaiśākhyāṃ saṃkrānau guptagaṅgām atrasthāṃ gaṅgām eva manyamānāḥ sarva eva kāśmīrikāḥ
analyzed: vaiśākhyām saṃkrānau guptagaṅgām atra sthām gaṅgām eva manyamānāḥ sarve eva kāśmīrikāḥ
translated: on the transit of Vaiśākha, all the people of Kashmir, considering the Ganges here as Guptagangā,

original: sabālavṛddhāḥ snātuṃ samāyānti /
analyzed: sa bāla vṛddhāḥ snātum samāyānti
translated: come to bathe, along with children and the elderly.

original: asya pradeśasyādhunā īśabhrāra iti nāmāpi vadanti /
analyzed: asya pradeśasya adhunā īśabhrāraḥ iti nāma api vadanti
translated: They also say that this region now has the name Īśabhṛt.

original: tatra īśasya īśānasya bhrār devatā iti yataḥ kaśmīrabhāṣāyāṃ bhror bhrār iti khyātaṃ padadvayaṃ devadevyor arthe vidyamānaṃ dṛśyate /
analyzed: tatra īśasya īśānasya bhrār devatā iti yatas kaśmīra bhāṣāyām bhroḥ bhrār iti khyātam pada dvayam deva devyoḥ arthe vidyamānam dṛśyate
translated: There, since Īśa, Īśāna, is the deity of bhṛt, the two words bhro and bhṛt, which are known in the Kashmiri language as denoting the god and goddess, are seen to exist.

original: tatrāpi bhror devaḥ bhrār devīti /
analyzed: tatra api bhroḥ devaḥ bhrār devi iti
translated: There also, bhro is the god and bhṛt is the goddess.

original: punaś ca devatāśabdasya śāstre striyāṃ vartamānasya bhrār iti bhāṣāyām api strītvenaiva vyapadeśaḥ /
analyzed: punar ca devatā śabdasya śāstre striyām vartamānasya iti bhāṣāyām api strī tvena eva vyapadeśaḥ
translated: And again, in the scriptures, the word devatā is used for a female, and in the vernacular language also it is designated as feminine.

original: grāmīṇās tu asya iśabhrār padasyāpabhraṃśavaśāt iśavar iti kathayanti /
analyzed: grāmīṇāḥ tu asya padasya apabhraṃśa vaśāt iti kathayanti
translated: But the villagers, due to the corruption of the word iśa-bhrāṭ, pronounce it as iśavār.

original: punaś cāyaṃ pradeśo yasmin puragaṇo vartate tasya puragaṇasya phākpargaṇa iti nāma bruvāṇāḥ santi /
analyzed: punar ca ayam pradeśaḥ yasmin pura gaṇaḥ vartate tasya pura gaṇasya iti nāma bruvāṇāḥ santi
translated: And again, there are those who say that this region is named Phākpurgam of that city-group in which the city-group is located.

original: ayaṃ puragaṇaḥ kaśmīranagarāt krośatrayeṇa dūre vartate /
analyzed: ayam pura gaṇaḥ kaśmīra nagarāt krośa trayeṇa dūre vartate
translated: This city-group is located three krośas away from the city of Kashmir.

original: atra gamāgamau jalamārgeṇa naukābhis tathā sthalamārgeṇāpy aśvādinā bhavataḥ /
analyzed: atra gama āgamau jala mārgeṇa naukābhiḥ tathā sthala mārgeṇa api aśva ādinā bhavataḥ
translated: The journey here is by water route in boats and also by land route on horseback and so on.

original: ayaṃ pradeśo niśāt vāgākhyo pavanāt pādonakrośadūratāyāṃ bhavati /
analyzed: ayam pradeśaḥ niśāt pavanāt pāda ūna krośa dūra tāyām bhavati
translated: This region is called Niśāt Vāgā, and is located one and a quarter krośas away from the wind.

original: atraiko jalāśayaś śītalajaś catuṣkoṇākāro 'ntar asti /
analyzed: atra ekaḥ jalāśayaḥ śītala jaḥ catuṣkoṇa ākāraḥ ntar asti
translated: Here, there is an inner lake of cool water, shaped like a square.

original: punaś caitādṛśa evānyo 'pi jalāśayas tasyāntaḥsthajalāśayasya vārye pradeśe vartate /
analyzed: punar ca etādṛśaḥ eva anyaḥ pi jalāśayaḥ tasya antaḥstha jalāśayasya vārye pradeśe vartate
translated: And again, there is another such lake located in the water region of that inner lake.

original: ubhayor eva jalāśayayor madhye 'lpaḥ prākāra iṣṭakāpāṣāṇādinirmito 'dhunāpy avaśiṣṭo bhāti /
analyzed: ubhayoḥ eva jalāśayayoḥ madhye lpaḥ prākāraḥ iṣṭakā pāṣāṇa ādi nirmitaḥ dhunā api avaśiṣṭaḥ bhāti
translated: In the middle of both the water reservoirs, a small wall made of bricks, stones, etc. still shines today.

original: paraṃ tu snānādivyavahāro vārya eva jalāśaye bhavati /
analyzed: param tu snāna ādi vyavahāraḥ vāryaḥ eva jalāśaye bhavati
translated: However, the practice of bathing, etc. is only in the water reservoir.

original: āntare tu kevalaṃ pūjanādikam eva sarvaiḥ kriyate /
analyzed: āntare tu kevalam pūjana ādikam eva sarvaiḥ kriyate
translated: But all perform only the worship, etc. inside.

original: asya jalāśayasyoparitane bhāge purātanarājanirmitam ekaṃ mandiram api sarvathāvinaṣṭam ākṛtyaivopalakṣyamāṇaṃ ādyāpi dṛśyate /
analyzed: asya jalāśayasya uparitane bhāge purātana rāja nirmitam ekam mandiram api sarvathā vinaṣṭam ākṛtyā eva upalakṣyamāṇam ādyā api dṛśyate
translated: On the upper part of this water reservoir, an ancient temple built by the king is completely destroyed, but is still seen today, only indicated by its shape.

original: kathayanti tatratyā anyāś ca vṛddhāḥ /
analyzed: kathayanti tatratyāḥ anyāḥ ca vṛddhāḥ
translated: The locals and other elders say:

original: ayaṃ devālayo rajñā sandhimatinā svasya guror arthe sampādito 'stīti mandirasaṃgrahādāv api sandhimatir evāsya pradeśasya kartā jñāto bhavati
analyzed: ayam devālayaḥ rajñā sandhimatinā svasya guroḥ arthe sampāditaḥ sti iti mandira saṃgraha ādau api sandhimatiḥ eva asya pradeśasya kartā jñātaḥ bhavati
translated: This temple was built by King Sandhimati for his guru. In the collection of temples, Sandhimati is known as the builder of this region.

original: asmāt pradeśād ūrdhvaṃ parvato 'py anyo 'sti /
analyzed: asmāt pradeśāt ūrdhvam parvataḥ u pi anyaḥ sti
translated: Beyond this region, there is another mountain.

original: ata evedaṃ sthānaṃ parvatasya pādadeśe bhāti /
analyzed: atas eva idam sthānam parvatasya pāda deśe bhāti
translated: For this very reason, this place shines in the foothills of the mountain.

original: asmin parvate kiyanmātradūratāyāṃ gopītīrthābhidhaṃ tīrtham api bhavati /
analyzed: asmin parvate kiyat mātra dūra tāyām gopītīrtha abhidham tīrtham api bhavati
translated: On this mountain, at a distance of only a few miles, there is a holy place called Gopī-tīrtha.

original: grāmīṇā apabhraṃśāt tasya gupatrath iti nāma vadanti /
analyzed: grāmīṇā apabhraṃśāt tasya gupatrath iti nāma vadanti
translated: The villagers, due to their dialect, call it Guphratha.

original: atreśānatīrthāt katicit padāni gatvādhastane bhāge guhāpy asti /
analyzed: atra īśāna tīrthāt katicid padāni gatvā adhastane bhāge guhā api asti
translated: Here, having gone a few steps from Ishana Tīrtha, there is a cave in the lower part.

original: tasyā guhāyā nikaṭe sāhibapadavācyānāṃ vaiṣṇavabrāhmaṇānāṃ gṛham apy asti /
analyzed: tasyāḥ guhāyāḥ nikaṭe sāhiba pada vācyānām vaiṣṇava brāhmaṇānām gṛham api asti
translated: Near that cave, there is also a house of Vaishnava Brahmins called Sahibabada.

original: te brāhmaṇāḥ kadāpi māṃsādi na bhakṣayanti /
analyzed: te brāhmaṇāḥ kadāpi māṃsa ādi na bhakṣayanti
translated: Those Brahmins never eat meat or such things.

original: atrādhunikarājakṛtārambhamandiram ardhasampannam apy asti /
analyzed: atra ādhunika rāja kṛta ārambha mandiram ardha sampannam api asti
translated: Here, there is also a half-completed modern royal palace.

original: etaj jalāśayadvayaṃ caturbhir eva digbhiḥ prākāraveṣṭitam adhunā vartate //
analyzed: etat jalāśaya dvayam caturbhiḥ eva digbhiḥ prākāra veṣṭitam adhunā vartate
translated: And these two reservoirs are now surrounded by walls on all four sides.

original: Loloraṃ Lolaraṃ vā
analyzed: loloram lolaram vā
translated: Lalore or Lalore

original: ślokasaṃ nambara caturaśīti ślokād ārabhya varṇyamāne lavarājñaś caritre loloraṃ lolaraṃ vā /
analyzed: ślokasam nambara caturaśīti ślokāt ārabhya varṇyamāne lava rājñaḥ caritre loloram lolaram vā
translated: In the story of King Lava, which is being described starting from the 84th verse of the Shloka Sam, there is Lalore or Lalore.

original: tatra loloraniruktiḥ /
analyzed: tatra lo loḥ aniruktiḥ
translated: Here is the explanation of Lalore.

original: lolāś cañcalamanasaḥ rānti dadati ye te rāḥ dātāra iti yāvat /
analyzed: lolāḥ cañcala manasaḥ rānti dadati ye te rāḥ dātāraḥ iti yāvat
translated: Those who give, who give to the restless, the fickle-minded, are donors, that is the meaning.

original: na rāḥ arā adātāraḥ /
analyzed: na rāḥ arāḥ a dātāraḥ
translated: Those who do not give are non-givers.

original: lolāś ca arāś ca janā yasmin sthāne nivasanto bhavanti sa loloraḥ /
analyzed: lolāḥ ca arāḥ ca janāḥ yasmin sthāne nivasantaḥ bhavanti sa loloraḥ
translated: That place where the restless and non-givers live is Lalore.

original: atha vā laḥ śeṣe ca bhaye khyātaḥ śāstrataḥ pūrvasūribhir ity ekākṣarakośokter laḥ
analyzed: atha vā laḥ śeṣe ca bhaye khyātaḥ śāstrataḥ pūrva sūribhiḥ iti eka akṣara kośa ukteḥ laḥ
translated: Or, according to the one-syllable lexicon, the letter la is known as the remainder and fear in scriptures by the ancient sages.

original: śeṣaṃ bhayaṃ ca tatrāsya maṇḍalasya śeṣatayā prāntasthitirūpayā yad ayaṃ pradeśaḥ
analyzed: śeṣam bhayam ca tatra asya maṇḍalasya śeṣa tayā prānta sthiti rūpayā yat ayam pradeśaḥ
translated: The remainder and fear are there, as this region is situated at the edge of this mandala as a remainder.

original: sthito yataś cātiprāntarakāntāragahvarādimārgair bhayayutaś ca /
analyzed: sthitaḥ yatas ca ati prāntara kāntāra gahvara ādi mārgaiḥ bhaya yutaḥ ca
translated: And it is situated with paths full of fear such as extremely remote wildernesses and caves.

original: kiṃ tu kevalaṃ sthānamanoharatvādinaiva raḥ sukhado yaḥ so 'pi loloraḥ /
analyzed: kim tu kevalam sthāna manohara tva ādinā eva raḥ sukha daḥ yaḥ saḥ pi
translated: But only the region that gives pleasure by its captivating nature and so on is the letter ra, which is also a fickle chest.

original: atha dvitīyasya lolaranāmno niruktiḥ /
analyzed: atha dvitīyasya lolara nāmnaḥ niruktiḥ
translated: Now, the etymology of the second one named Lolarana.

original: nānāvidhavṛkṣalatāgulmajalaṃ sthalādibhaṃgībhiś cañcalo yaḥ sa lolaḥ /
analyzed: nānāvidha vṛkṣa latā gulma jalam sthala ādi bhaṃgībhiḥ cañcalaḥ yaḥ sa lolaḥ
translated: The one who is fickle with various kinds of trees, vines, shrubs, water, and the forms of land and so on is Lolar.

original: atimanoharatvena ratisukhaṃ dadāti yas sa raḥ /
analyzed: ati manohara tvena rati sukham dadāti yaḥ sa raḥ
translated: The one who gives the pleasure of love by being extremely captivating is Ra.

original: lolaś cāsau raḥ lolaraḥ /
analyzed: lolaḥ ca asau raḥ lolaraḥ
translated: And he is Lolar, and he is Ra, so he is Lolarana.

original: yad atra pradeśe tena lavanāmnā rājñātyadbhutaṃ nagaraṃ nirmitam ato 'tra lolaraṃ lavapuram ity arthapratītir api samīcīnā /
analyzed: yat atra pradeśe tena lava nāmnā rājñā ati adbhutam nagaram nirmitam lolaram lavapuram iti artha pratītiḥ api samīcīnā
translated: Since an extremely wonderful city was built here by King Lavana, the understanding of the meaning here as Lolarana and Lavapura is also correct.

original: tathā ca paṇḍitakalhaṇasya rājataraṅgiṇyāḥ prathamataraṅgasya pañcāśītitame śloke
analyzed: tathā ca paṇḍita kalhaṇasya rājataraṅgiṇyāḥ prathama taraṅgasya pañcāśītitame śloke
translated: And thus in the eighty-fifth verse of the first wave of the Rajatarangini by the scholar Kalhana,

original: tena ṣoḍaśabhir lakṣyair vihīnām aśmaveśmanām /
analyzed: tena ṣoḍaśabhiḥ lakṣyaiḥ vihīnām aśma veśmanām
translated: Thus, having constructed a city of a crore of houses without sixteen lakhs of houses,

original: koṭiṃ niṣpādya nagaraṃ lolaraṃ niramīyateti //
analyzed: koṭim niṣpādya nagaram lolaram niramīyata iti
translated: he created the city of Lolaram.

original: lavapuraśabdasyaivāpabhraṃśavaśato 'yaṃ lolareti nāmānumīyate /
analyzed: lavapura śabdasya eva apabhraṃśa vaśataḥ yam lolarā iti nāma anumīyate
translated: From the very corruption of the word Lavapura, this name Lolaram is inferred.

original: kecit pārisekabhāṣānirmitarājataraṅgiṇyanuvādakartāraḥ /
analyzed: kecid pāriseka bhāṣā nirmita rājataraṅgiṇī anuvāda kartāraḥ
translated: Some are the expounders of the Rajatarangini composed in the language of Parishaka.

original: so lavābhidho rājā sarvadaiva gītipriyo 'tiśayenābhūt /🔽atas tadrājyakāle ye tatkṛtalolaranāmni nagare nivasamānā janapadā āsaṃs te tṛptasya
analyzed: saḥ lava abhidhaḥ rājā sarvadā eva gīti priyaḥ tiśayena abhūt  atas tad rājya kāle ye tad kṛtalolara nāmni nagare nivasamānāḥ janapadāḥ āsan te tṛptasya
translated: That king named Lava was always very fond of singing.🔽Therefore, the people who lived in that city named Lolaram built by him during his reign, considering the king's fondness for singing in every way,

original: rājño gānapriyatvam eva sarvathā samākalayya gāyanaśikṣāyām evāniścayaṃ kurvāṇās
analyzed: rājñaḥ gāna priya tvam eva sarvathā samākalayya gāyana śikṣāyām eva aniścayam kurvāṇāḥ
translated: being uncertain only in the training of singing,

original: sarva eva gītividyākuśalā babhūvuḥ /
analyzed: sarve eva gīti vidyā kuśalāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: all became skilled in the science of singing.

original: ata eva kaśmīrabhāṣāgānaviṣaye tasyaiva rājño lavalaveti nāma prathamaṃ gānārambha evākarayamāṇās tasthuḥ /
analyzed: atas eva kaśmīra bhāṣā gāna viṣaye tasya eva rājñaḥ lavalava iti nāma prathamam gāna ārambhe eva a karayamāṇāḥ tasthuḥ
translated: For this very reason, in the singing of the Kashmiri language, they remained as the first singers, attributing the name of that very king Lava to the beginning of singing.

original: yasya lavalaveti bhūpanāmnaḥ kālena mahatā lolo iti śabdo 'pabhraṃśavaśāt sphuṭībhūtaḥ tenaiva lolośabdena deśo 'pi saḥ khyātiṃ prāptaḥ /
analyzed: yasya lavalava iti bhūpa nāmnaḥ kālena mahatā iti śabdaḥ upabhraṃśa vaśāt sphuṭībhūtaḥ tena eva saḥ khyātim prāptaḥ
translated: The name of the king of that place was Lavala, which over a long period of time became distorted to Lolu through the influence of the vernacular, and it is by that very word Lolu that the country became known.

original: ato lolav iti nāmāsya sthānasya ityādi svapustakeṣu likhanti /
analyzed: atas iti nāma asya sthānasya ityādi sva pustakeṣu likhanti
translated: Therefore, in their own books, they write that the name of this place is Lolu.

original: vartate cādhunike kāle 'pi kaśmīrabhāṣāyāṃ ayaṃ luḥluḥśabdo gānamadhye pādapūraṇārtho gāne varṇanīyasya priyasya sambodhanārthaś ceti sarvajanaviditaṃ 🔽bhavati /
analyzed: vartate ca ādhunike kāle kaśmīra bhāṣāyām ayam luḥ luḥ śabdaḥ gāna madhye pāda pūraṇa arthaḥ gāne varṇanīyasya priyasya sambodhana arthaḥ ca iti sarva jana viditam  bhavati
translated: And in the Kashmiri language of the present day, this word Lu Lu is well known to all people as being used in songs to fill out the meter and as an address to a beloved person who is being sung about.

original: asmin puragaṇe eko grāmas tādṛśo 'pi bhavati /
analyzed: asmin pura gaṇe ekaḥ grāmaḥ bhavati
translated: In this group of cities, there is also a village like that.

original: yasyādhunike kāle sarve janā lulur iti nāma vadanti /
analyzed: yasya ādhunike kāle sarve janāḥ luluḥ iti nāma vadanti
translated: In the present day, all the people call it by the name Lulur.

original: ato hetor api grāmasyāsya nāmnaivāyaṃ sarvaḥ puragaṇo 'pi lolavśabdābhidheyaḥ sajjāta ity api /
analyzed: atas hetoḥ api grāmasya asya nāmnā eva ayam sarvaḥ pura gaṇaḥ sat jātaḥ iti api
translated: For this reason also, this entire group of cities has come to be designated by the word Lolu, even by the name of this village.

original: kecid grāmīṇā nāgarikāś ca svamataṃ sthāpayanti /
analyzed: kecid grāmīṇāḥ nāgarikāḥ ca sva matam sthāpayanti
translated: Some villagers and city-dwellers establish their own opinion.

original: ekena madhyasthitena grāmeṇāpi puragaṇaḥ sarvas tacchabdābhidheyo bhavatīty anyeṣu sthāneṣv api jñāyate /
analyzed: ekena madhya sthitena grāmeṇa api pura gaṇaḥ sarvaḥ tad śabda abhidheyaḥ bhavati iti anyeṣu sthāneṣu api jñāyate
translated: Even by a single village situated in the middle, the entire group of cities becomes denoted by that word, so it is known in other places as well.

original: tathā hi nāgām ityākhyapuragaṇa ekenaiva madhyasthitena kasavanāgām ity ākhyena grāmenaiva nāgāmpadavācyo bhavati /
analyzed: tathā hi nāgām iti ākhya pura gaṇaḥ ekena eva madhya sthitena kasavanāgām iti ākhyena grāmena eva nāgām pada vācyaḥ bhavati
translated: For example, the group of cities called Nāgā becomes denoted by the word Nāgāṃ by a single village situated in the middle called Kasavanāgā.

original: grāmīṇās tu etarhi asya lolarākhyapradeśasya lolavpargaṇa iti nāmaiva prakhyāpayanto bhavanti /
analyzed: grāmīṇāḥ tu etarhi asya lolara ākhya pradeśasya iti nāma eva prakhyāpayantaḥ bhavanti
translated: But the villagers now proclaim the very name of this region called Lolā as the group of villages Lolā.

original: aparaṃ ca asya grāmasya lulur iti khyātasya yat nāma puragaṇo 'pi sarvo bibharti /
analyzed: aparam ca asya grāmasya luluḥ iti khyātasya yat nāma pura gaṇaḥ sarvaḥ bibharti
translated: Moreover, the entire group of cities bears the name of this village known as Lulur.

original: tasya lālpor iti nāma kathayanti /
analyzed: tasya iti nāma kathayanti
translated: They say that its name is Lālpur.

original: asmiṃl lolarapradeśagamanāgamane madhya ekaḥ parvato 'pi bhavati /
analyzed: asmin lolara pradeśa gamana āgamane madhye ekaḥ bhavati
translated: In the middle of going to and from this Lolā region, there is also a mountain.

original: yam āruhyaiva sarvadā janānāṃ gamāgamau bhavataḥ /
analyzed: yam āruhya eva sarvadā janānām gama āgamau bhavataḥ
translated: Having climbed it, the comings and goings of people always occur.

original: ayaṃ puragaṇaḥ kramarājyasthapuragaṇayor utar khuyahom ityākhyayor madhye bhavati /
analyzed: ayam pura gaṇaḥ krama rājya stha pura gaṇayoḥ iti ākhyayoḥ madhye bhavati
translated: This group of cities is situated between the two groups of cities called Utār and Khuyhōm in the kingdom of Krama.

original: yata uktapuragaṇadvayamārgeṇāpi yiyāsūnāṃ mārgalābho bhavati /
analyzed: yatas ukta pura gaṇa dvaya mārgeṇa api yiyāsūnām mārga lābhaḥ bhavati
translated: Even by the path of these two mentioned groups of cities, those who wish to go find a path.

original: ayaṃ pradeśaḥ kramarājyasyāpi prāntabhūmau yataḥ sthito 'sty ato 'sya niruktau śeṣatayā sthityādikathanam api samīcīnam eva saṃgacchate /
analyzed: ayam pradeśaḥ krama rājyasya api prānta bhūmau yatas sthitaḥ asti niruktau śeṣa tayā sthiti ādi kathanam api samīcīnam eva saṃgacchate
translated: This region is also on the outskirts of the Krama kingdom, so it is quite appropriate to mention its location and other details in the Nirukta as a remainder.🔽However, what Kalhana wrote in his own book,

original: paraṃ tu ṣoḍaśalakṣyavihīnā yā koṭir arthāc caturaśītilakṣyāṇy aśmamayagṛhāṇāṃ sampādya nagaraṃ lavena rājñā niramāyītyādi kalhaṇena yat svapustake 🔽likhitam astīti /
analyzed: param tu ṣoḍaśa lakṣya vihīnā yā koṭiḥ arthāt caturaśīti lakṣyāṇi aśma maya gṛhāṇām sampādya nagaram lavena rājñā niramāyi ityādi kalhaṇena yat sva pustake  likhitam asti iti
translated: that King Lava built a city by accomplishing 84 lakhs of stone houses, which is less than 16 lakhs,

original: tāni gṛhāṇy ādhunike kāle 'tiyātacirakālavaśād vinaṣṭāny ato naiva dṛśyante /
analyzed: tāni gṛhāṇi ādhunike kāle tiyāta cira kāla vaśāt vinaṣṭāni atas na eva dṛśyante
translated: those houses are not seen today because of the passage of a long time in the modern age.

original: kiṃ tu pāṣāṇagaṇāḥ sarvatra bahavo darīdṛśyante 'to jñāyate te pāṣāṇās teṣām eva gṛhāṇāṃ śeṣībhūtopalakṣaṇībhūtāś ca syuḥ /
analyzed: kim tu pāṣāṇa gaṇāḥ sarvatra bahavaḥ darīdṛśyante jñāyate te pāṣāṇāḥ teṣām eva gṛhāṇām śeṣībhūta upalakṣaṇībhūtāḥ ca syuḥ
translated: But many groups of stones are seen everywhere, so it is known that those stones would be the remaining and characteristic stones of those very houses.

original: asya lolavpuragaṇasyādyo yo grāmaḥ saḥ khumariyāl ityākhyayā yaś cāsyānte grāmaḥ sa lālporākhyayā prakhyāto bhavati /
analyzed: asya lolavpura gaṇasya ādyaḥ yaḥ grāmaḥ saḥ iti ākhyayā yaḥ ca asya ante grāmaḥ sa lālpoḥ ākhyayā prakhyātaḥ bhavati
translated: The first village of this Lollapur-group is known as Khumariyal, and the last village of this is known as Lalpora.

original: asya khumariyālgrāmasya madhye 'tiśītalajalo jalāśayo vartate /
analyzed: asya khumariyālgrāmasya madhye tiśītala jalaḥ jalāśayaḥ vartate
translated: In the middle of this Khumariyal village, there is a very cool water reservoir.

original: punaś cāsya nikaṭa eva caṇḍīgrāmaś caṇḍīdevyāspadībhūtajalāśayayuto bhavati /
analyzed: punar ca asya nikaṭe eva caṇḍī grāmaḥ caṇḍīdevī āspadībhūta jalāśaya yutaḥ bhavati
translated: And again, near it, in its vicinity, there is the village of Chandi, endowed with a water reservoir that has become the abode of the Goddess Chandi.

original: tasya caṇḍīgrāmasya grāmīṇabhāṣāyāṃ caṇāgom iti nāma /
analyzed: tasya caṇḍīgrāmasya grāmīṇa bhāṣāyām caṇāgom iti nāma
translated: And that village of Chandi has the name Chanagom in the local language.

original: īdṛśā evānye bahavo grāmā devatāspadībhūtāḥ satīti śam //
analyzed: īdṛśāḥ eva anye bahavaḥ grāmāḥ devatā āspadībhūtāḥ satī iti śam
translated: There are many other such villages that have become the abodes of deities. May there be peace.

original: Ledarī
analyzed: ledarī
translated: Ledari

original: ślokasaṃ nambara lavasyaiva rājñaś caritre ledarī /
analyzed: ślokasam nambara lavasya eva rājñaḥ caritre ledarī
translated: In the biography of King Lavasya, there is a place called Ledari.

original: atra niruktiḥ /
analyzed: atra niruktiḥ
translated: Here is the explanation.

original: laḥ śeṣe ca bhaye khyāta iti śivaproktaikākṣarakośoktyā lo bhayaṃ tasmin le bhaye bhayotpādanavelāyām iti yāvat darī guhā vadati /
analyzed: śeṣe ca bhaye khyātaḥ iti śiva prokta eka akṣara kośa uktyā laḥ bhayam tasmin le bhaye bhaya utpādana velāyām iti yāvat darī guhā vadati
translated: According to the one-syllable lexicon composed by Shiva, which states La is known as the remainder and fear, Le means fear. Ledari means at the time of producing fear, there is a cave or hole.

original: gabhīrā gahanā dustarā ca yā dṛśyate sā ledarī /
analyzed: gabhīrā gahanā dustarā ca yā dṛśyate sā ledarī
translated: That which is seen to be deep, difficult to fathom, and difficult to cross is Ledari.

original: atha vā daḥ kalattrebudhaiḥ prokto dānacchedanadātṛṣu ity ekākṣarakośamatena /
analyzed: atha vā daḥ kalattre budhaiḥ proktaḥ dāna chedana dātṛṣu iti ekākṣarakośa matena
translated: Or, according to the one-syllable lexicon that states Da is said by the wise to mean cutting, giving, and being a giver in the sense of cutting and giving,

original: le bhaye daṃ chedanaṃ bhayacchedanaṃ rāti dadāti yā sārī /
analyzed: bhaye dam chedanam bhaya chedanam rāti dadāti yā sārī
translated: Ledari is the river that gives the cutting of fear, the cutting of fear when fear arises.

original: arthāt bhaye saṃjāte tacchedanadātrī bhayacchettrīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: arthāt bhaye saṃjāte tad chedana dātrī bhaya chettrī iti arthaḥ
translated: In other words, it is the cutter of fear, the giver of the cutting of fear when fear arises.

original: etādṛśī yā nadī /
analyzed: etādṛśī yā nadī
translated: That is the kind of river.

original: asyā ledarīnadyā bhṛṅgīśasaṃhitām atāvalambanena lambodarīti nāmāpi kecid vadanti /🔽tatra lambam udaṃ rayasya sa lambodaro gaṇeśas tanmukhāt niḥsṛtāyā nadī tasyā lambodarīśabdena vyapadeśaḥ vartate /
analyzed: asyāḥ ledarī nadyāḥ bhṛṅgīśa saṃhitām atas avalambanena lambodarī iti nāma api kecid vadanti  tatra lambam udam rayasya sa lambodaraḥ gaṇeśaḥ tad mukhāt niḥsṛtāyāḥ nadī tasyāḥ lambodarī śabdena vyapadeśaḥ vartate
translated: Some people, taking the support of the Bhrngi-samhita of this Ledari river, call it by the name Lambodari.🔽There, the one with a long belly is Ganesha, from whose mouth flows a river, which is designated by the word Lambodari.

original: cāmareśvarayātrāmārge gaṇeśabalābhidhe pradeśe mahaty ekā nadīmadhyasthitā gaṇeśasyāśmamayī pūjyatamā prakhyātamūrtiḥ /
analyzed: cāmareśvara yātrā mārge gaṇeśabala abhidhe pradeśe mahatī ekā nadī madhya sthitā gaṇeśasya aśma mayī pūjyatamā prakhyāta mūrtiḥ
translated: On the path of the Chamaresvara procession, in the region called Ganeshabala, there is a large stone image of Ganesha in the middle of the river, which is greatly worshipped.

original: yasyā mūrtes sākṣād gajīkṛtitvaṃ dhārayantyāḥ puṣkarāt nirgacchantī pītojjhitevaiṣā nadī bhāti /
analyzed: yasyāḥ mūrteḥ sākṣāt gajīkṛti tvam dhārayantyāḥ puṣkarāt nirgacchantī pīta ujjhitā iva eṣā nadī bhāti
translated: From the lotus of that image, which bears the form of an elephant, this river seems to flow out, as if it were yellow.

original: paraṃ tu ledarīti nāmnāpy asyā nadyāḥ sopapattikaṃ saṃhitāsaṃgataṃ cāpy asti /
analyzed: param tu ledarī iti nāmnā api asyāḥ nadyāḥ sopapattikam saṃhitā saṃgatam ca api asti
translated: But there is also a reason for this river being called Ledari, which is related to the samhita.

original: yato 'smin dakṣiṇapārśvākhyapuragaṇe yasminn eṣā nadī pravahati tatra lidar ityākhyo grāmo 'syā nadyās taṭapradeśasthito 'sty atas tadākhyayāpy
analyzed: yatas smin dakṣiṇa pārśva ākhya pura gaṇe yasmin eṣā nadī pravahati tatra iti ākhyaḥ grāmaḥ nadyāḥ taṭa pradeśa sthitaḥ asti atas tad ākhyayā api
translated: Because in this region called Dakshinaparshva, where this river flows, there is a village called Lidar located on the banks of this river, therefore it is also known by that name.

original: eṣā nadī prakhyātiṃ prāptā /
analyzed: eṣā nadī prakhyātim prāptā
translated: This river has thus become famous.

original: yato lidare grāme yā pravahati sā ledarī nadī /
analyzed: yatas lidare grāme yā pravahati sā ledarī nadī
translated: Because the river that flows in the village of Lida is the Lida river.

original: bhṛṅgīśasaṃhitāyāṃ mārtāṇḍamāhātmyavarṇane 'py anenaiva nāmnāsyā nadyā nāmagrahaṇam /
analyzed: bhṛṅgīśasaṃhitāyām mārtāṇḍa māhātmya varṇane anena eva nāmnā asyāḥ nadyāḥ nāma grahaṇam
translated: In the Bhṛṅgīśa Saṃhitā, in the description of the greatness of the sun, this river is mentioned by this very name.

original: tathā hi yāvac cākā pravahati nadī ledarī toyapūrṇā yāvan nāgau yamalakamalau tiṣṭhato matsyam uktau yāvad bhāsvāṃs tapati gagane nityaśaḥ
analyzed: tathā hi yāvat cākā pravahati nadī ledarī toya pūrṇā yāvat nāgau yamala kamalau tiṣṭhataḥ matsyam uktau yāvat bhāsvān tapati gagane nityaśas
translated: As it is said: As long as the river Leda flows full of water, as long as the two serpents, the twin fish, remain, as long as the sun shines in the sky every day,

original: kālaśaktyā tāvat svarge vasati /
analyzed: kāla śaktyā tāvat svarge vasati
